explanation: Nuclear fusion is the process where light atomic nuclei combine to form heavier nuclei, releasing energy when the products have higher binding energy per nucleon. This process powers stars and is the basis for fusion energy research. The reaction requires overcoming the Coulomb barrier between positively charged nuclei, typically achieved at high temperatures and densities.

definitions.definition: Energy released in the fusion reaction (Q-value).
Total rest mass of reactant nuclei.
Total rest mass of product nuclei and particles.

assumptions: The nuclei have sufficient kinetic energy to overcome the Coulomb barrier.
The reaction products separate to infinite distance (complete energy release).
Conservation of energy, momentum, and nucleon number apply.
The reactant nuclei are initially at rest in the center-of-mass frame.
Non-relativistic kinematics apply for the reaction products.

derivation.description: Set up initial state with deuterium and tritium nuclei at rest.
derivation.equation: Initial: ^2 H + ^3 H (at rest, total energy = M_D c^2 + M_T c^2)

derivation.description: Define final state with alpha particle and neutron having kinetic energies.
derivation.equation: Final: ^4 He + n (with kinetic energies T_alpha + T_n)

derivation.description: Apply conservation of energy including rest mass energies and kinetic energies.
derivation.equation: Energy conservation: M_D c^2 + M_T c^2 = M_alpha c^2 + M_n c^2 + T_alpha + T_n

derivation.description: Define Q-value as the energy available for kinetic energy of products.
derivation.equation: Q = T_alpha + T_n = (M_D + M_T - M_alpha - M_n) c^2

derivation.description: Apply conservation of momentum: products have equal and opposite momenta.
derivation.equation: Momentum conservation: vec p_alpha + vec p_n = 0

derivation.description: Since initial momentum is zero, final momenta are equal in magnitude.
Express kinetic energies in terms of momentum for non-relativistic particles.
derivation.equation: T_alpha = p^2/(2 M_alpha), T_n = p^2/(2 M_n)

derivation.description: Determine energy sharing between neutron and alpha particle from momentum conservation.
derivation.equation: T_n = Q * M_alpha/(M_alpha + M_n), T_alpha = Q * M_n/(M_alpha + M_n)
